ResponsesInList.Title: Fatal error with h5pactivity_page_type_list() on Moodle 4.5 using h5plib_v127
ResponsesInList.Text: To clarify what may be happening. PHP deprecated implicit nullable parameters in 8.4 and removed them in 8.5. So that the problem may occur if you are running Moodle 4.5 with PHP 8.4 and debugging turned on or in with PHP 8.5. It is probably not a good reason to either of those on a production Moodle 4.5 site. MDL-86822 fixes more recent Moodle versions.

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P "Word Cloud" activity
ResponsesInList.Text: The limitation is that this content type runs on H5P.com only. If you want to use it on Moodle, you'll have to pay for an H5P.com account and include the content in Moodle via LTI (or embedding).

ResponsesInList.Title: Activity Completion Problem
ResponsesInList.Text: The way that I would go about this, is add the video using the 'h5p interactive video' element - I would add an interaction at the end of the video which asks a question. This could be asking them something factual from the video (with an identified correct answer), or this could be a question along the lines of - 'having watched the video, are you ready to move onto the quiz' (where yes = correct, no = incorrect) You then have the necessary information to check 'completion' - which is then used to make the quiz activity available. An alternative (and less good) way of doing this, is to make the quiz available but not shown on the course page, you then (again using h5p interactive video) add a summary screen which includes the link to the quiz. I have done this with a client who specifically wanted this, but this isn't great for the person to revisit the quiz in the future, and if you create a new course based on this one, you would have to remember to go into the H5p to update the link to the quiz.

ResponsesInList.Title: Activity Completion Problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Which version of Moodle are you using? And are you using the core H5p item, or the 3rd party H5p activity. With newer versions of Moodle and the core activity you should be able to set the required passing grade within the h5p activity setup itself. If you cannot do this (e.g. older moodle or 3rd part plugin) what you have to do, is do this via the gradebook - which is a bit fiddly. Go into the Gradebook, and Gradebook setup

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P attempts report
ResponsesInList.Text: We are using Moodle 4.5. I'm wondering if there are any plans to improve the (core) H5P attempts report page - it would be good if it was more like the quiz attempts page. If there are a large number of users in a course, and a small number of attempts, there seems no way to easily navigate to those attempts. I have courses where there are hundreds of pages of users listed. The quiz attempts page shows only the attempts, rather than all users whether or not they have attempted it. This would be much more useful. We use groups, and for teachers within groups they only see their own groups, so at least for those teachers it is easy to find the attempts. However, the page only tells a teacher how many attempts there are across all users, which is of no interest to them - they want to know how many attempts there are for their own groups. Again, the quiz attempts report does this very well as it states the total number of attempts and also the numbers from the teacher's own groups. It would be great if these features could be added in the future.

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P interactive video - submit
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello all, I want the answers after each activity to be submitted directly, without having the need to use a separate submit screen. How can I do this for H5P interactive video? TIA Prasita

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P interactive video - submit
ResponsesInList.Text: You'd need to change the code of Interactive Video, there's no such setting, unfortunately. The downside of this approach would be that you'd get multiple attempts registered inside the gradebook, one for each transmission. The other downsides would be those implied by patching and forking. Note that all involved H5P contents (the main content and its subcontents) send out xAPI statements ("results") individually. The respective H5P integration (e. g. the plugin for Moodle or Moodle's own integration) could pick those up and store them as they see fit, but commonly do not. They only keep track of the main content, which in this case is Interactive Video. In other words: This could also be done by changing the code of the H5P integration (Moodle) without the need to change content types (and would help for some other content types, too). You'd probably have to introduce the concept of preliminary scores though, if Moodle's gradebook (or other host platforms' grade books) don't have that in order to make clear that the user has not completed the exercise. And, of course, there would be some variations, but long story short: You won't make that happen without changing code. Alternative: Use a Learning Record Store instead of Moodle's Gradebook, but that's likely not want you want.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 4.4 branching scenario with video (video is flickering/shaking)
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle 4.46 with H5P built-in feature (not the plugin) Boost theme (however, changing theme to Classic does not solve the issue) I have a branching scenario with a video on one of the pages and as soon as the video loads it starts shaking (does not even need to be playing). I removed all custom css for the theme and in the H5P settings and it makes no difference. Has anyone had this happen?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 4.4 branching scenario with video (video is flickering/shaking)
ResponsesInList.Text: There was a problem a few versions back, where the 'container' that contained the H5p content was dynamically reacting, so it would load, then resize itself slightly to fit, but that then changed the dimensions, so it resized again - and it basically got into a repeated loop of making itself slightly bigger then slightly smaller which appeared to the user as flickering. If my memory is correct it only did it on certain browsers (sorry I forget which) and it only did when the screen width was within a certain range (e.g. it didn't happen on narrow screens or very wide screens). The solution was to add some CSS to change the way the container behaved - but as this was a few versions back, I no longer have that code, but if you use the inspect tools to inspect the page as it is doing it, you may be able to work out the culprit, and make the necessary tweak to stop it from happening. Apologies for being slightly vague here, but it was 4 or 5 years ago that this happened - I thought it had gone away for ever so didn't keep the code that fixed it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 4.4 branching scenario with video (video is flickering/shaking)
ResponsesInList.Text: thank you so much for replying! Yes I suspect it is a sizing issue but I've inspected and not found anything that works. But I will press on. IF ANYONE ELSE KNOWS THE SOLUTION, please reply... this is keeping us for upgrading past our current version of 4.3. Note it did not happen in that Moodle version, and removing all custom CSS did not solve the issue. We have not changed anything except the Moodle version.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 4.4 branching scenario with video (video is flickering/shaking)
ResponsesInList.Text: Solved by adding additional css to h5p settings: html.h5p-iframe, html.h5p-iframe > body { width: 102%; height: 102%; } html.h5p-iframe .h5p-content { width: 60%; height: auto;

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P best procedure
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I've used Moodle for years as well as the blue H5P quite a bit lately. However, after searching the forums, I can't find a description or specification of what's the best or an effective procedure to create, reuse, and safely save H5P activities within Moodle, Lumi, and your own computer. Also, I'm sorry to ask, but I can't see the advantage of Moodle content bank so far ... Thank you in advance. Luciana

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P best procedure
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luciana, The content creation and editing is part of part of the H5P core used in all of the implementation should be consistent. Portability is meant to be a feature of H5P. I think the most important difference in the options is how the package files are stored and managed. The content bank provides a convenient place to store a content package so that it may be used in more that one place with out duplicating the file. A package in the content bank can be included with the filter in multiple locations or the file can be linked into activity using the Moodle file system using the content bank repository which is searchable. If you edit the package, changes will appear every the package is linked. These features are unique to the content bank implementation. If you do not need these file management features, it does not matter as much which implementation you use (the other implementations may be more straight forward because that lack these features).

ResponsesInList.Title: Conditional Access to Quiz Results Based on Score
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Moodle Community, I’m looking for guidance on setting up an H5P quiz in Moodle 4.1 where students need to score at least 80% to see which questions they got wrong. The requirement is that: Students who score 80% or higher should be able to review their incorrect answers along with the correct answers for further learning. Students who score below 80% should not have access to any feedback or see which questions they answered incorrectly. I’ve explored various settings and options, but I haven't found a straightforward solution that meets these criteria. Has anyone implemented a similar setup? Any suggestions or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thank you in advance for your help! Best regards, Danny Charland Account Manager | Catalyst IT

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Conditional Access to Quiz Results Based on Score
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Danny from Catalyst, Short answer is : it can't be done with H5P alone. But... if you combine an H5P activity with the power of Moodle, you can get a workable result. Here’s a detailed approach to achieve this goal: First, create the quiz using H5P and integrate it into Moodle as an H5P activity. Make sure that the H5P content is set to record attempts (using xAPI if necessary) to accurately track scores. Then, use Moodle’s grading feature to record the results of the H5P quiz. This will enable you to use the grade as a condition for accessing feedback. Next, create an additional activity or resource (such as a page or file) that contains the correct answers or feedback on the students' mistakes. Use Moodle’s "Restrict Access" feature to ensure that this resource is only available to students who have achieved a grade of 80% or higher. To configure this, go to the resource settings, then to "Restrict Access," and add a condition based on the H5P quiz grade (e.g., Grade >= 80). By default, students with a score below 80% will not be able to see the resource containing the feedback, as the access restriction will automatically exclude them. Finally, make sure to test this setup with a student account to verify that the access conditions work as intended. This method leverages Moodle's conditional access features alongside the flexibility of H5P activities to meet the specific feedback requirements. By ensuring that grade tracking is enabled for the H5P activity, you can precisely control who has access to the feedback. HTH --C

ResponsesInList.Text: I'm getting H5P error Unable to load libraries

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  H5P error Unable to load libraries
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jaswant, And thank you for saluting the group whose members strive to provide free and voluntary assistance. The error message "Unable to load libraries" in H5P can occur for several reasons. Here are the most common ones: Missing or Incompatible Libraries: If the required H5P libraries are missing or incompatible with the current version of H5P, you might get this error. Incorrect File Permissions: If the file or directory permissions are incorrect, H5P might not be able to access the required libraries. Improper Installation or Update: If the H5P plugin was not installed correctly or an update was interrupted, some libraries might not load properly. Database Issues:

ResponsesInList.Title: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: I am currently bumping around H5P core, creating a small interactive book. I create 10 questions in the content bank thinking I could insert them into the interactive book. This does not seem to be the case. I can add to the interactive book page, a new question. But we cannot insert existing questions from the same content bank. Is that true? Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: Each instance of an H5P activity in the content bank stand on its own. But I assume you're talking about questions in the "question bank" instead of "content bank" : there is no connection between the two. The only way to reproduce content is, depending on the purpose : 1/ copy/paste the text into the new activity, OR 2/ copy/paste the h5p activity (the 2 buttons up right the edit window) and adapt the text for new use HTH C.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Shirley. I haven't tried this with more recent versions and it is a really old fix - but... I remember this problem myself years ago and the solution was to turn off the 'filter once per page' setting - see MDLSITE-6269 Does that help?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: You can insert many H5P content type questions into Interactive Book, but not all (e.g. TrueFalse is not supported, but Multiple Choice is). The only interface for inserting an existing H5P into an Interactive Book is the copy and paste function of the H5P editor. Open one of the existing questions by clicking edit button in content band, click 'Copy' button in the editor, navigate to your Interactive Book and edit it, click 'ADD CONTENT' and the the 'Paste' button in the new content. The past button is enabled only if there is a compatible content type in the clipboard.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P video creation
ResponsesInList.Text: To address your question regarding the creation of H5P content for use within the Moodle platform, it's important to know that you can indeed create H5P content directly within Moodle itself. If your Moodle site has the H5P plugin installed, you can create, edit, and manage H5P content right from within Moodle. This plugin integrates seamlessly and provides a user-friendly interface to work with H5P content without leaving your course environment. Additionally, as of Moodle 3.8 and later, H5P support is included as part of core Moodle. This means you have the capability to create and interact with H5P content directly within Moodle without the need for any additional plugins. This core integration also supports the tracking of student interactions with the content, which can be incredibly beneficial for educational purposes. HTH C.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can't 'get' activities in H5P Interactive Content Plugin [Moodle 4.0]
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Adam, It could be that the cron task , that picksup contenttypes has not 'run' yet. I noticed this with new installations, since the task frequents is like 1 a month, when you have a new install it does not straight away 'downloads'/ 'make the contenttypes' avaiable. If you are a site admin (or when not give them these instructions): Login to site Go to Server > scheduled task search for the task " Download available H5P content types from H5P.org (\core\task\h5p_get_content_types_task) if the column last run says "never' then click on the radar fill in at minute */1, the rest is * Save the changes Wait 1 to 5 minutes (it kind of depends on how frequently your cron is running) Refresh the page, check if column last run now has a data and time Click on the 'radar' again check thebox "Reset task schedule to default" Save changes Go to the COntent bank and check if you now see Contentypes. If this did not work, check with your technical team/server contantperson if the Cron is correctly configured. Redo the steps. I hope this fixed your issue. Gemma

Many of the chapters in the course are made up of 3 - 10 H5P files. I would like the experience for students to be as seamless as possible, and not have to go back out to the course menu between H5Ps. I am looking for some best practices here. I will also need to be able to Restrict Access to future chapters until earlier chapters are completed. So, I need to preserve completion data - not for individual H5Ps, but for the collection that make up a chapter. I have some H5Ps that are quizzes. I'm fine with the quiz being a separate experience so that it can be graded on its own with no complications. I have seen some discussion about putting these all on a page, book, or lesson activity. Does someone have a resource for which method to use and why, or a pros / cons list for each, or something helpful in the way of best practices here? Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best Practices for Combining Multiple H5P into a single experience?
ResponsesInList.Text: My go to H5P tool is the 'Interactive Book' which is considered and 'Aggregator' Content Type (CT). We use this for student's study guides.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Where are the other knowledgeable programmers? and why aren't they helping to set the record straight? H5P was not designed for assessments (only). It should be (and is) usable for all kinds of contents and content for teaching and learning also goes way beyond the notion of assessments. B ut if high-stakes assessments are that crucial (I am not a teacher, I cannot judge) , then choosing client-side evaluation was clearly a design flaw. I don't know the background however, so I can't tell what the prerequisites were. Server-side evaluation is on the roadmap of H5P Group, but I don't thing this is going to hit the shelves soon, because it would mean quite some work to redesign the core of H5P and also existing content types. So, the answer to "Where are the other knowledgeable programmers?" most likely is at "H5P Group". There are not too many H5P developers outside of the H5P core team, at least as far as I now of. I also don't believe that the moodle team is going to invest resources. And my answer to "why aren't they helping to set the record straight" would be manifold: lack of documentation (for external contributors), lack of interest (the moodle team included H5P in core even though they knew it's using client-evaluation when they started, and they probably don't want to invest resources in "competition" that would make it easier to get server-side evaluation into other platforms, too), lack of funding (the number of developers who would work on this in their free is tiny), complexity of the project (many technical aspects, possibly even coordinate developers inside and outside of the H5P core team), ...

So there is room for both types of questions. However, as Marcus said, people should be aware of the differences, which many probably aren't. As for me, I know now. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! H5P editors fill out a form that is structured by the semantics.json file (even if there's a visual editor used as in Course Presentation, in the end one fills out the form). That semantics.json file can easily be understood, in particular if you look at the rendered editor next to it. It's quite obvious that for "Multiple Choice" the answers field holds the answer options including the text and the correct state. The structure will vary from content type to content type, but the principle is the same for all of them. The H5P Core transfers all the parameters that were entered by the editor from the server side to the iframe on the client side by passing a JSON object that follows the same structure as semantics.json. You could retrieve that information as part of the `window.H5PIntegration` object as `window.H5PIntegration.contents[cid-<contentId>].jsonContent` directly from memory. Just try running `for (id in window.H5PIntegration.contents) { console.log(JSON.parse(window.H5PIntegration.contents[id].jsonContent)); } // no error handling` in the development console inside either the H5P iframe's context or its parent's context and explore the output. You could even find the answers without knowing about the semantics.json file ... You could do the same programmatically as well, of course. Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problems with Course Presentation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Laurent, It seems the system cannot load the needed component, and your hypothesis of a disrupted scheduled task could be correct. One way to check that : run the task manually... For that : find the relevant task in the scheduled tasks click on the wheel to access the settings set al time/day fields on *. Keep only the minute one on */1 Run cron manually : in the site security settings, set " Cron execution via command line only" on "no" load the page https://[site.example.com]/admin/cron.php set "Cron execution via command line only" on "yes" again Check execution : go back to the task page and check the last execution time for the h5p task if not set to now, run the cron again check if the h5p activity error is connected If done, don't forget to reset the execution planning of the h5p task. HTH Christophe

To reproduce: On course page, go into edit mode Click on "Add an activity or resource" Select the H5P core activity (blue button) in the activity selector On the parameters page, give a title On the parameters page, drag/drop a H5P package into the "Package file" zone Save and return to course Open the Content Bank (Course main menu More > Content Bank) The H5P package we added is not there. Which is not the behavior you should expect and contradicts with the sentence on parameters page "Use the content bank (opens in new window) to manage your H5P files". This is also not documented on https://docs.moodle.org/401/en/H5P_activity . Any thoughts about the why? Is this a bug or is it useful? Christophe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Christophe, I hadn't noticed this, but it is quite expected from my understanding. The content bank is like the H5P authoring tool and it only contains the activities that are created there or the ones that have been added manually there, it's not as sophisticated as an aggregator.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Beatriz, Thank you for your reply! In my opinion is this behavior not intuitive, which is again another source of confusion in the use of H5P (see my other threat about this). H5P is scoring high in Moodle HQ's 2022 Integrations Surveys Results . Let's hope HQ will hear the sound of the cries of the users... Anyone other thoughts about the glitch I mentioned? Christophe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: @Christophe, 1.- I agree that this is confusing. The sentence "Use the content bank (opens in new window) to manage your H5P files" should be removed from that screen, it's useless and confusing. 2.- There are 2 ways to add an H5P content when using the blue icon: a) directly dropping an H5P content created elsewhere (e.g. with Lumi) into the Files box; b) clicking on the Add icon, which takes you to the Content bank where, hopefully, you have previously created the H5P you need. "You can drag and drop file s here to add them " is wrongly formulated, since you are only allowed (of course) to drop one H5P file in that box. This should be re-formulated. 3.- I expect the Moodle programmers who integrated H5P into core could not make up their mind whether to only accept creating H5P course activities by using H5P contents previously created in the Content Bank or to provide an easy "shortcut" for using H5P contents created outside the Content Bank. Hence the regrettably confusing interface. 4.- Anyway, I agree with your original post question "where does it go?". If an H5P content (created elsewhere)  is inserted directly into a course activity it should automatically be made available in the Content bank. This would be coherent with the way questions are created and inserted into a quiz activity. Questions for a quiz are either created beforehand in the Questions bank where they become available to a new quiz, or created when a new quiz is created, and subsequently become part of the question bank and available to any new quiz.😃

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: @Joseph, 4 - good point : coherency with the Questions Bank ! Christophe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: Forcing the #4 behaviour would have to mean that this H5P activity must use the "by reference" (linking) method. Dropping the file immediately into the activity (currently) means you do NOT want to use the Question Bank to edit but just load the file. I think there should be an option for the teacher given there: - Do you want to simply embed the package into the activity (without adding it to the Question Bank)? OR - Do you want to add the package to the course's Question Bank, link to it from this H5P activity, and be able to edit the package in this course's Question Bank? Or something to this effect.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Math expression in H5P; Cornell notes
ResponsesInList.Text: Both your question that you also posted on the H5P forum have already been answered there. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backing Up and Restore courses with h5p activities
ResponsesInList.Text: FYI - From what I have seen there is a problem with H5P embeds and activities when you LINK to the original in the Content Bank (alias). If you store a copy, restore works. (Though of course linking makes major sense because editing of H5P can only be done in the Content Bank...) A workaround would be to ALWAYS CLEARLY NAME those H5P activities which are linked to. Then - after restore - you should be able to mend the broken links. Maybe even now, in the courses you moved, there will be some hints in the embedded links that will tell you out the H5P file's name you can try to re-link . It's unfortunately much worse in the case of activities - here the aliased file disappears completely, and so there's no hint - unless you remember which activity it was, or can check back at the original course location.

Do we have to keep using H5P plugin to retain the data after moodle upgrade?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Are there any issues after Moodle upgrade - transition to H5P Plugin to H5P built-in plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle's own H5P version works independently from the H5P version you already have in use. While there are plugins which allow the conversion from the original H5P plugin to the Moodle version, it is probably a good idea to continue using the original version for the meantime. Once you are familiar with both version, you can make an informed decision whether to use only one version or keep both versions around.

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P attempts list does not respect groups

ResponsesInList.Title: Next/Prev activity links are not refreshed once H5P is graded
ResponsesInList.Text: The activity navigation links (shown at the bottom of an activity) are not refreshed after a H5P grade is saved. If the next activity is restricted conditionally based on the score (or pass/fail) of the H5P, the link to the next activity can vary and is not immediately refreshed once the H5P is finished. The only solution is to have the student go back to the course overview page or have them refresh their browser so that Moodle unlocks the correct restricted activity. Has anyone else ran into this issue or know of any way to solve it? It was confirmed by the development team that this is a bug, but I would like to see if anyone has any workarounds! This is for a self-guided learning course and I would like to move the student in the correct direction after finishing a quiz in H5P. If the student performed well (let's say over 75%), then I want them to move on to the next topic. Otherwise, another practice activity in the same topic should be shown. I am hoping to achieve this without having the student go back out to the course overview page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Next/Prev activity links are not refreshed once H5P is graded
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't believe this is a H5P specific issue. You are talking about activity completion, and restrictions. It's important to understand that completion activity is not "instant" because it relies n the Cron job of the server . So in this case, where you want almost instant changes in completion status, you would want to set your Cron to run every minute.

ResponsesInList.Title: After a student complete a H5P Quiz, it takes too much time to change the status to done.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, I have added in each of my lessons a H5P Activity, that uses a H5P Question Set. Sometimes, when the students finish the Quiz, it take too much time to change the status to "Passed", and since the activities are connected together, the student cannot do the next one. Has anyone an Idea how to fix this? Thanks a lot.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: After a student complete a H5P Quiz, it takes too much time to change the status to done.
ResponsesInList.Text: Completion data, like many other aspects of Moodle, is controlled by the scheduled task = cron job. These days that should be set to a couple of minutes, probably 5 at maximum, unless your site is absolutely huge. So you should maybe take a look at how often the cron job is running now.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: After a student complete a H5P Quiz, it takes too much time to change the status to done.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stuart, thanks a lot for your reply. I noticed that my server dosent allowd cron jobs below 15 min, this is why I'm running them now externlly every minute. And the system status in Moodle shows that they are running well. But I still have this problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: After a student complete a H5P Quiz, it takes too much time to change the status to done.
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess you may be on a shared hosting system then, if Cron is restricted to 15 minutes. So you have setup an external server service to trigger Cron remotely. You also need to check that the specific scheduled tasks around completion are not too long. I just checked on Moodle 3.11, and they appear to be default at ASAP (result being they should calculate on each Cron run), but I'm not sure about earlier versions, they may be set to 5 minutes for example to spread out the load. Might be some H5P scheduled tasks worth checking also.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosting H5P on Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nick, This should be possible if the users have rights to access the pluginfile. This usually means that it is part of a activity that has guest access enabled. I think that means you would need to enable auto login guests on site, add guest access to a course, and make sure guest can preview activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosting H5P on Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: I would assume so if access is unauthenticated (ie ungraded, untracked). If you were looking for LTI features of h5p.com, Moodle can be set up as a LTI provider and any module can be configured as an LTI offering. I do not know whether Joomla supports LTI, but I would not be surprised if it did.

It takes in the h5p package and gives you a zip file with all the standalone files included. Maybe it could help, rather than dealing with all the guest access requirements and linking to the correct pluginfile.php, etc. https://frumbert.github.io/h5p/index.html

ResponsesInList.Title: CurrikiStudio as an option to publish H5P to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: As a non-profit, Curriki has been working diligently over the last two years to develop a free and open, independent and embedable content authoring suite that leverages H5P, LTI and xAPI. Our goal is to make it easy to author, distribute and deliver active learning experiences. As a long-time fan of Moodle and H5P, we are at point where we are ready to start a much deeper integration to Moodle, especially by using LTI 1.3/Advantage. I would like to begin a discussion to evaluate the merits and shortcomings of this new suite within the context of the needs of both Moodle authors, as well as Moodle developers. A long-time fan and admirer, Leo Cunha CTO, Curriki.org

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: CurrikiStudio as an option to publish H5P to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: That seems to be an interesting option if you can host another server or pay for it. The LUMI app ( https://lumi.education/ ) can also be used for making and editing H5P modules. It is also free, open source, and you can download an app for PC, Mac or Linux and run it in your own device, without installing or paying for a server. Plus, it has a great multi-language support for the names and descriptions of all H5P modules.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: CurrikiStudio as an option to publish H5P to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Leonardo, I am not sure I understand the intent of your message above and am not sure what response you are wanting. This forum deals mostly with the two current implementations of H5P available in Moodle as well and using H5P as an LTI consumer. It mostly involves user problems with those methods. If you are providing a source for H5P materials, this may the right place. Developers that work on those implementations often respond in this forum to problems, but if you with details of setting up a new integration, there may be more developers interested in the General development forum or in LTI forum. It might also help to create a tracker issue if you want attention from the core development team. Moodle HQ is interested in Open Educational Resources as is Joubel and both are working at establishing content hubs. You may have luck contacting either of those directly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: CurrikiStudio as an option to publish H5P to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel, You are right, I may have misplaced the post My intent was exactly what you mention. On one side, as a provider of OER technology, it is exactly what you mention - to collaborate on a content hub, as well as to provide a tighter integration between the content hub and LTI/xAPI compliant LMSs. As a long-time user and integrator of Moodle, I am working on strategies that can also make it easier for (a) authors to build, sequence, and distribute H5P activities , (b) make it more seamless for learners to consume those experiences inside the LMS, and (c) leverage xAPI/Learning Record Store to standardize the collection of learning analytics across LMSs compliant with open standards.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activity doesn't fit in page....
ResponsesInList.Text: The content is adjusted to fit your screen/window size. The user on a desktop can change size of the content by reducing the width of the window. Content should be designed to display on a device with a reason aspect ratio. In your example the image is 500 by 229 which is unusually wide. The aspect ratio of the Dialog card also depends on the content. Placing a tall picture a card or long text is going to make it so users have to scroll.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Embedding H5P - changing width and height of video?
ResponsesInList.Text: Because H5P content is HTML5 it will always fill the maximum space / correct ratio. That's so the responsive nature will 'fit' the actual display (not use absolute sizing). Without using some (fairly advanced) HTML code you can't alter the size, and in 99% of cases if you did it would cause problems on different screen sizes that you didn't anticipate.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Embedding H5P - changing width and height of video?
ResponsesInList.Text: Video can be embedded in H5P course presentation and the the dimension set there relative to the size of the total course presentation. This however may make it appear to small on some devices. If you are embedding content with the H5P filter you can embed the link with a HTML container and set the max-width on the container on better use bootstrap col classes to choose with based on available screen resolution. For activities this coudl be done by overriding a template in the theme. Generally though I think the idea of responsive design is for users to control the sizing by changing their window size.

ResponsesInList.Text: This is not really something that the implementation can change with implementation. The content is usually embedded in an iframe. Right click to show 'This frame only', then search for jsonContent on the page source for to find the question source.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Its fundamental to the design difference between H5P and the Moodle Quiz. H5P is mainly in the browser and the Moodle Quiz never reveals the answer until it is ready. You have to be keen and determined to find the data in H5P, but if it is high stakes, someone will and once one person has you should assume everyone has.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Resume interactive video on login
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a H5P specific question. So it should be asked on the H5P community: https://h5p.org/forum As far as I know, the H5P Interactive Video does not have a 'resume' function.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Resume interactive video on login
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! This is possible if you activate the "save content state" option in the settings of the H5P plugin. If users are logged in, many H5P content types (including Interactive Video) will then store the current state in a regular time interval that you can set as well and whenever a task is checked. There's also a pull request for optionally adding that feature for users who are not logged in, but it will probably take some time until that one is added. This question becomes moodle related if you are not using the H5P plugin but the H5P integration into moodle core of moodle 3.8+. To the best of my knowledge, the moodle core version does not feature the "save content state" option. Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Resume interactive video on login
ResponsesInList.Text: Oliver is right. Unfortunately the very useful "Save content state" is not (yet?) available in the H5P integration into Moodle core version. I mentioned this issue in this post . Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, do you know of any security implications of letting students upload H5P content through the Atto editor, or in general? It comes by default on Moodle 3.9. Can they SPAM , crosscript or freeze other students' browsers with malicious H5P content? Is it even possible to create malicious H5P content? Best, Fabian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Fabian, as standard settings, the student role doesn't have access to the content bank, i.e. they cannot create any H5P content. I have checked and, in the case of an essay question, the Atto editor doesn't display the H5P button in a student role, so there are no security issues in this regard. But the best would be to create and dummy student account and check how is the role configured in your site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Beatriz. I didn't think of login in as a student to see if the button appeared or not. Apparently it doesn't appear by default for the student role in the Atto. Thank you! Best, Fabian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: It is possible to create a malicious content type, but new content types have to uploaded by a system administrator. It can not be done by normal users. Javascript is loaded from the content types. When editing content users can really only change plain text. The H5P filter allows users to include content from external sites, but only those on a list specified by the admin as safe. It is possible that malicious code is on one of those sites if the admin is not careful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Daniel, That was very useful too. Best, Fabian

ResponsesInList.Title: Permissions for students to create H5P content
ResponsesInList.Text: I have spend a few hours tweaking roles and permissions on a development Moodle with the goal to have students create their own H5P content from within a Moodle course but no luck so far.  I got close by allowing student role to manage activities (moodle/course:manageactivities) but that created additional unintended results in that students could manage other activities as well. I am on Moodle version 3.9. In addition, I looked at database activity but students only seem to be able to supply a link to H5P content but neither upload it nor create it. In Forum activity, .h5p files can be added by the student role which is good but does not meet my needs. I am curious what I should be looking or searching for next to find a way to have students create H5P in Moodle (just like a teacher can). I don't want to send students to H5P.org Thank you in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Permissions for students to create H5P content
ResponsesInList.Text: If you want students to be 'Teachers' in a certain context , isn't that better achieved by using the Assign Roles options, rather than editing the Role itself? e.g. if you want Students to be Teachers, in a specific Course, you can make them Teachers in that Course. Making Students into Teachers within a Courses in a specific context is also possible. But if you edit the Student Role, to give them moodle/course:manageactivities capability then anyone with the Student Role will have that permission and capabilities EVERYWHERE they are enrolled as a Student ! Is that really what you want ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Permissions for students to create H5P content
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dirk, The H5P editor in 3.9 works in the content bank. The content bank is in the course context so there is only one per course. If you allow students to access it they will be able to use all the content there (belonging to other students), but you can restrict them to editing there own content. If that is okay, students should be able to then include any of the content in other activities like wiki or glossary entries using the H5P filter. You do not need to use the H5P activity unless you need to have results of the activity recorded in grade book (which students should not normally access).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Content Types in new integration

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-05-08 - A New Hope
ResponsesInList.Text: On the Star Wars Day (May the 4th), 2020 arrived the code freeze of version 3.9. We are proud to say that all the new planned H5P features arrived on time and they are now waiting for integration. Since then we have been working on their integration and on solving any related bug issues. We invite you all to try the beta version of the complete Moodle H5P solution at our demo site: https://h5p.moodledemo.net/ We also would like to encourage you to collaborate with the Moodle QA testing and help us to make 3.9 the best Moodle version ever. The QA testing will start on monday but H5P tests will arrive a bit later when all pending issues are integrated. Hot Topics The following issues have been integrated this week: MDL-67713 : Include H5P Activity backup and restore options MDL-68379 : the core library supports xAPI result, attachments and context MDL-68381 : Add duration, completion and success to H5P activity attempts MDL-68502 : mod_h5pactivity produce an error on filepicker when the file is deleted MDL-67800 : Implement events for content bank MDL-67790 : Rename content in the content bank Warm thanks To all the integrators of the HQ House, Guardians of the Code, Bearers of the Tracker Status, Protectors of the Master Branch and, hopefully, not Breakers of the Code Freeze. Thanks for your passionate and hard work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Interactive Video (1.21.8) not working after Upgrade to 3.7.4
ResponsesInList.Text: We've made a recent upgrade from Moodle 3.4 to Moodle 3.7 and found that all H5P content of type "Interactive Video" stopped working. When attempting to view or edit any H5P interactive video on our Moodle site, we simply get a timeout resulting in bad session locks. I'll list all the relevant specs and changes I can think of: New Moodle version: 3.7.4 Change of $CFG->cachedir and $CFG->localcachedir Content Type library updated from 1.21.2 to 1.21.8 Servers (both production and test) are running memcached for sessions H5P version is 1.20.2 on both servers Directory permissions are identical on both servers (777 for moodledata and separate cache dirs) I've tried to replicate the issue on our test system and was successfull in doing so by simply moving said cache directories to their default location (in moodledata) and back (to their custom directory). That was enough. Strangely enough, on our test system, I have been able to remedy the situation by simply deleting "cache", "localcache", "sessions", "temp" and "trashdir" (in both paths where applicable). On production, this doesn't seem enough. Only two differences between the systems: 1) Production has internet access and thus 2) Production has more current plugin and content type versions (see 1.21.2 vs. 1.21.8 above) I'm at an absolute loss. PHP Debugging on max level is not helpful: "session_start(): Unable to clear session lock record" I'm hesitant to start playing around with session handler, etc. My best guess is some interaction between H5P and the moodle cache. But not sure, how exactly... and even less what I could do about it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Video (1.21.8) not working after Upgrade to 3.7.4
ResponsesInList.Text: What happened when you originally tested this upgrade ? I mean, you must have tested the upgrade procedure before moving a production site from Moodle 3.4 to 3.7.4 right ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Video (1.21.8) not working after Upgrade to 3.7.4
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your reply, Stuart. I'll try to answer your questions as best as I can. When originally testing this upgrade, everything seemed fine. I needed to take some additional steps to reproduce the problem on the test system in the first place: Moving around the cache & localcache folders. It might be worth noting that these changes (moving cache & localcache to more performant storage) were the only changes not tested in detail on the test system. (i.e. we checked whether the whole system would work with these changes, but not every single activity) We can add new H5P content, including interactive videos. That seems to work. We also do have *some* existing interactive videos that work. There does not seem to be a predictable pattern which work and which don't, though the majority fails to load. Other H5P content seems to work just fine. I'm planning to stop the production server completely for a short period of time tomorrow morning, allowing me to clean all moodledata directories I think might be involved: cache, localcache, lock, temp, trashdir Might it be worth a shot to add the "muc"-folder to this list?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Video (1.21.8) not working after Upgrade to 3.7.4
ResponsesInList.Text: Tried everything mentioned. Switched cache directories back to standard. Emptied caches and other related directories. Changed session handler back to file sessions. Finally rebooted the server. Sadly, no change in behaviour. Next, we're going to give our test system an internet connection so we can update the H5P libraries to the same versions as we have on production. See if that makes the problem occur in the same stubborn way. -.-'

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Video (1.21.8) not working after Upgrade to 3.7.4
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, if the problem is cache related (and it doesn't sounds like it's version issue as new content is adding OK), then it's worth clearing all caches. But if you have a proxy or other similar service as well that could be involved?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Video (1.21.8) not working after Upgrade to 3.7.4
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello again, Stuart! We finally managed to resolve the problem. Our developer spent about his whole afternoon debugging and finally spotted the issue: In our php.ini, the value for "max_execution_time" was way too short, leading to writing processes to /temp being disrupted. Sessions were also corrupted within the process. After raising this value from about 30s to 300s, everything works fine. Cheers and thanks again for your time and insights

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-03-27 - A cold wind was blowing from the north, and it made the trees rustle like living things
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi everybody, This week, we have continued the hard work on H5P integration by advancing a more robust architecture at Content Bank and xAPI.  We are expanding the use of the Content Bank beyond the system level. Now, it can be used at the Course Category and Course level ( MDL-67786 ). On the other hand, substantial improvements have been applied to xAPI and we already have two of the key xAPI issues in integration, MDL-67734 and MDL-67788 within we can already
have tracking in the new H5P activity. Regarding the H5P Editor ( MDL-67814 ), we already have the issue in Peer review and we hope to have it in Integration soon. Furthermore, we are working on integrating the Moodle translation system in the H5P Editor ( MDL-68227 ) and adding a post in the translation forum where we explain our approach with the H5P editor localization.
Also, we would like to remove the ckeditor from the H5P Editor ( MDL-68240 ) in order to use the current editors in Moodle. Finally, the work in the Repository issue ( MDL-67812 ) has begun and it will allow to easily reuse the contents of the content bank. Hot topics The following issue has been integrated this week: MDL-68116 : Prepare Moodle to be ready when h5p.org down completely so that only the author can see the test content. We already prepared Moodle to be ready when this year H5P closes h5p.org down completely so that only the author can see the test content. We have removed https://h5p.org/h5p/embed/ [id] as default value in Display H5P filter and the embed field int the Atto button. It's important to notice that the api.h5p.org will continue to work and the only thing that H5P is going to change is the visibility of the test content on h5p.org, so that only the author can see it. Apart from that, there are several interesting issues waiting for integration review that hopefully will also land soon: MDL-67734 : Create basic skeleton for a global xAPI library needed for H5P content. MDL-67788 : Add xAPI statement support to mod_h5p. Tracking the students's attempts using xAPI in the H5P activity. Warm thanks We want to thank Eloy for taking such good care of us, for his enormous patience and great ideas. For always being available to all of us and accompanying us with his great experience and knowledge.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-03-20 - Please, stay safe at home
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everybody, This week we've been working on: xAPI redesign, to make the skeleton more extendable in the future. Thanks Andrew for your contribution and Ferran for your hard work here ( MDL-67734 ). Creating folders for organising the content and renaming existing content from the content bank ( MDL-67787 and MDL-67790 ). Integration of the H5P editor ( MDL-67814 ). The first version of the editor is almost ready to peer review. We're currently trying to figure out how to integrate H5P translations with Moodle system. All the issues planned for Moodle 3.9 can be found on the H5P epic ( MDL-67425 ). BTW , the date of the next Moodle 3.9 release has been postponed one month and Moodle 4.0 is planned for November 2021. You'll find this information in the roadmap . Hot topics The following issue has been integrated this week: MDL-67707 : Create a new H5P activity. For now, it only lets teachers grade manually H5P activities . Integration with H5P automatic grading and reporting will be done in MDL-67788 , once xAPI skeleton lands. Apart from that, there are several interesting issues waiting for integration review that hopefully will also land soon: MDL-67786 : Create a new 'contentbank' plugin type and a new H5P plugin in the content bank. MDL-67795 : Delete content option in the content bank. MDL-68116 : Prepare Moodle to be ready when h5p.org down completely so that only the author can see the test content Warm thanks All the people around the world trying to make things slightly better and working hard against COVID-19. We are very grateful for their effort and involvement.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-02-07 - Building strong foundations
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everybody, Here we are again to tell you about our progress in the H5P project. This week we have been focusing on the basic structure and design of all different fronts we are working on: The first version of xAPI statement handler is already implemented, documented and waiting for peer review. You can find some more detailed information in xAPI MDL-67734 . The content bank is on its way. For now, the only module in core that uses content bank will be the H5P content manager, but we are sure more will come for future releases. And, as always in Moodle, everybody will be able to create their own content bank plugin as any other plugin type. We hope to get everything ready for Moodle 3.9 and encourage developers to create new plugins that suits their needs. We started working on the H5P core activity ( MDL-67707 ). This will enable users to create new core activities using existing H5P contents in the content bank. We will try to make it as compatible as possible with the current mod_hvp some of you are already using, to be sure you can continue using the content created in older Moodle versions. Hot topics: MDL-67060 : Improve admin UI to make H5P content types management easier for admins showing them all information together in the same page. MDL-67063 : Add a mechanism to support different H5P core_api versions in stable Moodle versions. Warm thanks: To Spanish healthcare system for taking care of some team members. It has been an intense week, but it's getting better.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-02-07 - Building strong foundations
ResponsesInList.Text: Excellent question Enrique I believe many people will be looking at this right now. By this, I mean administrators of sites already using H5P via the plugin. For the integration of H5P into Moodle core I believe it will be 100% essential that all existing H5P content in Moodle courses will be rendered correctly by the core plugin. I'm sure the Moodle developers working on this will understand the impact if this isn't the case.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-02-07 - Building strong foundations
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Enrique and Stuart,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-02-07 - Building strong foundations
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Amaia: This is going to happen just one time for Institutions having mod_hvp installed and with content. It would be fine for us to have a migration tool form ONE version of mod_hvp (perhaps the latest stable by April or so) to the initial version on mod_h5p in moodle 3.9. So we don't need this event been added and stored forever in the module db/upgrade.php For mod_h5p the history of upgrades would be clean, and always within mod_h5p. I', thinking something like the admin_tool tool_assignmentupgrade when mod_assignment was deprecated and mod_assign was born. The key point is that I think admins do not need a complete "any previous version of mod_hvp is compatible with any future version of mod_h5p". We need a path for upgrade, avoiding being trapped by scenarios where maximal upgradeable state in an install doesn't match with minimum upgradeable in the other branch. The current mod_hvp version 1.20.2 (2020020500) is compatible from moodle 2.7 up to 3.8. So, and admin migrating to 3.9 (or further) just will need to upgrade mod_hvp yo this 1.20.2 (2020020500) version (or other agreed with hvp people in these months before 3.9), then migrate to initial mod_h5p in a 3.9 installation, and then upgrade that to 4.0 or 4.3 in the future. I wholeheartly agree with Stuart that content migration is a must. Unthinkable otherways.  This must be part of the initial implementation plans for h5p integration in core.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-02-07 - Building strong foundations

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-03-06 - Landing countdown
ResponsesInList.Text:
It's been another week of intense work for all of us to enjoy H5P out of the box in Moodle. Although we still have many details to polish, and a handful of decisions to make, the core tasks of the project are on the verge of integration, closer than ever. We'll probably see any of them integrated next week: MDL-67063 - keeping updated H5P in your Moodle instance. MDL-67707 - H5P activties, a must. MDL-67734 - xAPI. Are you kidding me? Each one in their field of expertise is an inspiration and a reference to be followed. It wouldn't be as much fun without you girls.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-02-21 - Still, round the corner, there may wait, A new road or a secret gate
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, The Carnival has arrived at Moodle HQ and at the same time we have started our third sprint surrounded by the best possible environment. During this sprint, we will focus on finalizing the standalone version of the H5P Editor ( MDL-67814 ), we will provide the Content Bank with new features that will allow us to more easily manage the H5P content packages ( Epic 3.9 ) and integrate xAPI with the new H5P activity ( MDL-67788 ) allowing us to handle the tracking of the H5P contents. In addition, we are working on small issues that will turn the Moodle 3.9 H5P integration into a more robust solution ( MDL-67302 and MDL-67095 ). On the other hand, next week, the Moodle Moot Japan 2020 , from 26th to 28th, will be held in Kumamoto, Japan. There, our Moodle LMS Product Manager, Sander Bangma , will talk about H5P and the future of Moodle LMS. Another opportunity to hear directly from Moodle HQ. Hot topics: MDL-67337 Apply Display H5P filter inside <a> tags: From now on, when somebody copies an H5P content URL from a Chrome browser address bar and pastes it in Moodle's rich text editor, it is pasted as a link, inside <a> tags and the 'Display H5P' filter will be applied. MDL-67707 Create a new H5P activity: The first version of the new H5P activity is waiting for integration allowing progress in the integration with xAPI. MDL-67062 Add Admin UI to delete existing libraries: Allow Admins to be able to remove libraries from the Admin UI to Manage H5P content types. MDL-67786 Create a new 'contentbank' plugin type and a new H5P plugin in the content bank. MDL-67063 Add a mechanism to support multi H5P core_api versions. Warm thanks: We would like to thank our super developer, Amaia , an example of commitment, effort and knowledge at the service of the team. Tons of thanks for all the help you give us every day and your active participation in technical and functional decision making. It is blessed to have Amaia by our side.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-01-17 - The next Level
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi everyone, We're excited to announce the new features for the integration of H5P into Moodle 3.9 and the progress during these past weeks. Our main goal for Moodle 3.9 is: Integration of H5P content types with Moodle gradebook and activity completion. Improved integration of H5P content type selection in Moodle's activity chooser. To this end, we have worked hard to get a first functional prototype that covers most of the needs expressed in the studies and interviews conducted to the community throughout 2019. The result, is an approach that allows Moodle to be more versatile in content creation. To do this, we have created a prototype that separates the H5P activity module from content creation. Two clearly different mindsets. One for the activity and one for the content creation. In this way, a user can create or add new H5P content from Moodle without associating them with an activity. On the other hand, through the activity, you can access those contents in a simple way and use them through a new repository where you can
choose the H5P created in the Content Bank and take advantage of all the activity's functionalities as activity completion or grading. On the Content bank, you will be able to create, import and edit H5P files, among other functionalities.
Through this separation, we enhance the reuse of H5P contents that are created or imported into Moodle allowing them to be used in any activity or using the Atto editor or the filter anywhere in Moodle. It will help to provide Moodle with great
flexibility looking forward to the future. We would like to add all the news and progress in the integration of H5P and Moodle every week. Hot topics: You can check the prototype of the activity here . We will add the link to the Content Bank prototype as soon as possible. We are still working on a full version. You can check the Epic for 3.9 here . We are still finishing the work of adding issues in the epic. Warm thanks: To Rafael Lechugo our UX expert, for sharing with us his great ideas and for demonstrating great patience with all of us.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.9 and H5P Weeknote 2020-01-31 - Sprint 0, the project before the project
ResponsesInList.Text: We are finishing our first two-week sprint, plenty of meetings, focused on clarifying the architecture and interaction of the different H5P new features that will land on Moodle 3.9. Remember that H5P Epic for 3.9 is the central reference for tracking project progress. Hot topics We've been working on: xAPI ( MDL-67734 ) - xAPI statement validation and PHPUnitTests H5P editor ( MDL-67814 >) - getting a fully operational standalone version, no hvp plugin required. Finding out how to interact with the content bank. Content bank ( MDL-67786 ) - creating a new content bank type plugin (H5P will be the first one). Besides, we have been improving the initial integration of H5P available from Moodle 3.8, such as MDL-67063 (allowing several versions of the H5P core library to coexists) and MDL-67060 (enhanced libraries management). And finally, we have been working intensively on the prototypes of the content bank and how it will interact with the H5P editor: https://projects.invisionapp.com/share/2YVQAY2BCRJ#/screens/402513375 Warm thanks A big shout out to our team leader, Carlos Escobedo. Your guidance and leadership are taking us in the right direction!

ResponsesInList.Title: I really want to like H5P but...
ResponsesInList.Text: I really love the idea of H5P (new hotness). It is pretty easy to use. It usually looks good (if you build it well). I keep hearing people say it is better than SCORM (old and broke) and these are people who know what they're talking about. But I keep finding little things that are deal breakers. I can caption video. That's great! But if I add audio, no captioning. I can use YouTube video, which already has captioning (possibly bad captioning, but captioning)...but if I use it in interactive video, where I add questions or interaction, the captioning is gone. There's no way to get captions on a YouTube video with interactive video that I can find. Interactive video is so cool. But if you use a large video (what video isn't?!?), your whole site might suddenly start crashing. Yes, I'm sure. And reporting. This is a big one. First. The reports are...not easy to find. Why would I go to the gradebook for activity reports? Well, if I'm using H5P, that's where I go. If I create an interactive video module, my users have to answer the questions and then manually submit them for it to report to me that they have done anything. If they don't do the submitting thing (and there is no way to know you need to do this), it might not remember they did it. Sometimes it starts where they left off...and sometimes it doesn't. And if the site crashes because the video is big...it always forgets. (to be fair, really large scorm modules can muck things up too, but they remember doing it). I'm not hung up on WHEN they started, just that they did. And that they finish. And that it knows they finish. If I want completion to be contingent on completing the whole thing...well, there is no tracking. I can just click next indefinitely and not do anything. If I set up branching, there is a button at the top that lets me skip entire sections . If I want completion to be contingent on a specific score...well,It doesn't do completion on a particular score--only if a score exists...I could fiddle with grade book settings for a grade to pass but I'm not confident it would actually work, because, well scoring is weird. Really weird. I can get grades (or complete/incomplete) from SCORM. If I find an error and need to change it while it is being used by students, when I make the change, it forces my users to start over. Updating SCORM is easy and doesn't mess up reporting. If I want to know how people answered questions. Well, I'd better use something else. That's not something H5P does. SCORM does it (badly--but I can get the data!). I really want to use H5P but I don't think I can. I need these features that SCORM has. Discuss?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I really want to like H5P but...
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Melanie, I'm not as experienced as you in the use of SCORM , but I have written a lot of storyboards for SCORM-compliant tools such as Storyline and, before that, I had created materials with HotPotatoes and later with H5P for my own courses. I was surprised about how difficult it was to create interactive activities with Storyline or Articulate. We needed the job of an experienced developer and prototype and alpha and beta phases to create something that I could create in less than 30 minutes with other tools and update without problems. From this perspective, I found H5P better than SCORM.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I really want to like H5P but...
ResponsesInList.Text: So, I've created SCORM content with Lectora, Camtasia and Captivate. I've seen/manipulated content developed with other products. I've heard some really good things about Articulate (so your complaints are surprising. Back when I first started working with Lectora, if I had seen Articulate first, I probably would have gone that direction instead. But I love Lectora.) I've also used eXe and iSpring. Honestly, I recommend Quiz for testing always. SCORM reports results but cannot give any kind of effective stats on overall participation. Quiz gives stats. LOVE that. I don't test is scorms ever if I can help it (knowledge checks for interactivity, applicability stuff but not actual testing) My experience with people who complain about authoring software is that they generally haven't learned how to set them up properly or they don't think outside the box or they want something that does the hard stuff for them. It really helps to know what you want before you start. I think building in H5P is generally easy. I want to like it. I want to use it. But it can't do what I need with reporting and some of the 'interactions' are a bit clunky. I tend to build branching type stuff...there are four things you have to do but you can do them in any order you want, and my materials tell you when you've completed one. H5P...not so much...you can branch but it is more story branching than what I do. That said...I LOVE story branching! I have used it in the past for human resources training and case management training... I wish I could use it for what I do but the thing I need it...well, it's IT training, which makes story telling more complicated and I'll only have a month of development time (plus my regular job duties for supporting tech for all our departments, answering help calls and managing our Moodle) which isn't a lot of time. Research says a 1 hour on-line module should take about 80 hours of development. I don't think I ever take that long...but you're better off with smaller bites of content--10 to 15 minutes apiece (so, as much as 20 hours of dev)--our attention spans aren't that long and with our tech dependence, they are getting shorter! Tom Kuhlman (Articulate) calls short courses coursels, which I love--he is my hero, so awesome! (Well, and Dan Marsden and Tim Hunt. And Helen and Mary...) Interactivity takes time. You have to know what you want and how it should look/behave. If the student does X, what happens? If they do Y, what happens? It can help if you can create a template and build from there. I once built a course where the student had three case files they had to complete. It was mostly story telling and choose-your-own adventure types stuff with good ending and supervisors telling you you did the wrong thing. It took a ridiculous amount of time to build and was incredibly complicated...but it worked...later I stripped all the actual content out and saved it as a template shared it with a work group I'm a part of...I don't know what happened with it after (but people still talk about it and that was 2 years ago). Lectora is expensive, but I think worth it. It also allows a lot of granular control--variables, action sequences. In fact, if you want any interactivity, you must use variables and action sequences, which requires some braining and working out what you want and when. Captivate is less expensive (but getting more expensive every year) but gives less control--I could set conditions in lectora where if X was true (like a specific quiz grade or range was acheived) then the course would be marked complete at the end but I can't do that in Captivate--completion reporting is hard coded--you give it a grade for passing an that is it--I sometimes don't want 80%, I want a range because it isn't a quiz, it is an assessment of something (like a personality quiz) and Captivate is balls at that. And branching is hard in Captivate (it's hard anyway, from the brain standpoint, but harder). So, that was kind of a dis to people who complain about the tech...to be fair, I complain a lot about Captivate--but that is because it takes about 3 times longer to build something in it than Lectora. Knowing how to do something only gets you so far...but creating interactive video is pretty easy with H5P, which is why it was so attractive. It's fairly easy with Camtasia, as well, but there are weird things about reporting there, too (but it reports and reports completion) and sometimes it crashes or does weird stuff. The short answer is both of SCORM and H5P require skills (with the tech, with design, with knowing what you want). If you just want to share some information and don't care about tracking (like a ppt), it might be easier to use H5P (or upload the ppt). If you want tracking, SCORM works better because, well, it tracks. If you want interactive video and don't care about tracking, H5P is probably nicer to use. If you need to know the person actually did the whole activity, SCORM is better, in spite of being an oldster. And branching, well, if you want tracking and don't care about looking spiff, Lesson is fantastic. If you want tracking and pretty, SCORM. If you just want pretty, well, H5P is okay. But this is a data driven world. We want tracking. If it is just practice, that's fine, go for H5P. But if it isn't practice, I have to still go with SCORM. And that makes me sad.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I really want to like H5P but...
ResponsesInList.Text: I re-read my post this morning and realized, I really kind of under valued lesson . Lesson is fantastic. Period. You can, with skill and effort, make it look good. It isn't as easy to make pretty as H5P. You can do it though. The tracking is cool (not quite as nice as quiz, doesn't really track retakes for stats) but a little clunky. But in all ways, Lesson is still terrific. You can't do interactive video with it. But branching! Unbelievably powerful! None of that has anything to do with the inherent weaknesses of H5P...just didn't want to make it sound like I don't appreciate Lesson. I do. A lot!

ResponsesInList.Title: Interactive video creating open database connections, crashing server
ResponsesInList.Text: So, I created an interactive video with H5P. It is, admittedly, a long video--90 minutes. Throughout, there are questions (hence, interactive).  It went live and within about 45 minutes my server started acting strange. Users across the site started experience Server 500 errors, intermittently. We looked into it.  Something has been opening database connections, leaving them open, sucking up resources and then spontaneously aborting them.  And then the server crashes. It comes back up and starts all over again. Only one thing has changed: the H5P module went live and started getting use. We had no problems when testing it before the go-live, but then it was just me messing with it. So, it seems pretty likely that the issue is related to the H5P. I switched to H5P from SCORM because I didn't like the way the scorm published video couldn't seem to remember where it left off if the user had to stop and come back (Camtasia published scorms just aren't that smart. The alternative is manually captioning 90 minutes of video in Captivate. No. Just...no. Of course, that would work. but I've already spent hideous amounts of time fidgeting my captions to deal with the fact that Safari and Chrome only allow one line of caption...). I'm running Moodle 3.6.2 (will probabaly upgrade to 3.7 in November or Dec).  Does anyone have any ideas on how to fix this or why it would cause this problem?

Choose the DEVELOPER option and try the install again. And do you have access to your web server error logs?

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P Longevitty
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm sorry if this has been asked somewhere else or should not be posted here but we have several teachers in our division that are curious about H5P content.  The fact that it was created as a plugin by an external company has generated a few questions: How are they making money off of it? What happens if that company decides to pull that plug-in or ask for a payment for use? What is the liability if a teacher accidentally uses copyrighted material? Would the individual teacher be liable for that mistake? Thank you for the help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Longevitty
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Kevin! We're getting hired by several organizations (often universities or other institutions close to education) for extending the functionality of H5P. Also, in the very near future, there will be h5p.com which offers features on top of just providing content types, e.g. data storage or analysis. Those will not be free. H5P is open source software, so even we went down or became dickheads, someone could take the mantle and establish something like a core team to continue development. If someone wants to, he or she could also do that right now and fork the whole project. Feel free to judge how open and dedicated we are by having a look at our source code , lively discussions on our forums or our ticket system where you can even track what we're working on. We may be a company, but H5P is a community project and should be to a larger degree even. Are you asking if we should be held accountable for copyright infringement by others? Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Longevitty
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Q1 & 2: Yes, the idea of Free and Open Source Software is a change of paradigm. Read about the GPL http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.txt , which is also the https://docs.moodle.org/dev/License of Moodle. Q3: Accidents happen. But no software developer takes responsibility for accidents at the user end!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Longevitty
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply. I guess I worded the copyright question wrong. I was worried more about it in a different way.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Longevitty
ResponsesInList.Text: I am not sure whether you got the answers to your questions, Q1 and 2 I mean. > Q1. How are they making money off of it? Probably you meant https://h5p.org/ and got the answer from a developer. The point is, there are many, many different models in financing a FOSS product. To make the matters complicated, the model of a particular product may change during its history. So the general question has no full answer.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Longevitty
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Kevin! I guess #3 is hard to tell, because it can depend on the jurisdiction you're under or the organization you're in. For example, professors in Germany have something called "Institutshaftung" where the university is liable unless the professor was clearly negligent. It's different for teachers in schools, where the exact terms can depend on the federal district you're in, etc. Sorry for not being more helpful. Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Longevitty
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm betting your initial fear is that you have invested in 3rd party plugins in the past and gotten everyone onboard using it only to have the rug pulled out from underneath you. You don't want to be burned again and are being cautious in adopting any additional plugins. We are the same way.  So much so that we use Moodle for that very reason, in that we are in control of our LMS.  We can say with certainty that until we turn off the servers we can provide teachers with this service. We quickly adopted the H5P plugin based on what we saw in their forums, the usefulness of the plugin to teachers, and just a general feeling that this is too good to not offer to our teachers - even if it went away.  Almost an "enjoy it while you can" assumption. As you can see from Oliver they are very much interested in keeping this open source.  I wouldn't delay trying it out.  It's very good.
